isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY 27-SI SERIES, TYPE 200 - ALTERNATOR BENCH CHECK

svcproc.title: ALTERNATOR BENCH CHECK
svcproc.para: To check the alternator in a test stand, proceed as follows:

step1.para: Make connections as shown in Figure 16except leave the carbon pile disconnected.

important.para: Ground polarity of battery and generator must be the same. The battery must be fully charged.

step1.para: Slowly increase the alternator speed and observe the voltage.
If the voltage is uncontrolled with speed and increases above 15.5 volts on a 12-volt system, or 31 volts on a 24-volt system, test regulator with an approved regulator tester.

note.para: The battery must be fully charged when making this check.

step1.para: If voltage is below 15.5 volts on a 12-volt system, or 32 volts on a 24-volt system, connect the carbon pile as shown in Figure 16.
Operate the generator at moderate speed as required and adjust the carbon pile as required to obtain maximum current output.
If output is within 10 amperes of rated current output as stamped on generator frame, generator is good.
If output is not within 10 amperes of rated current output, keep battery loaded with carbon pile, and:

step2.para: Insert screwdriver into end frame hole to ground tab to end frame ( Figure 7).

caution.para: Tab is within 3/4 inch of casting surface. Do not force screwdriver deeper than one inch into end frame.

step1.para: Operate at moderate speed as required, and adjust carbon pile as required to obtain maximum current output.
If output is within 10 amperes of rated current output, remove regulator and check field winding.
If output is not within in 10 amperes of rated current output, check the field winding, diode trio, rectifier bridge and stator. Replace as required to obtain rated current output.
